Package ptree

Class PTreeMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • ptree.PTreeMethods

  • public class PTreeMethods
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains static methods to work with a tree.

                                      Configuration config)

      • deleteIntermediateDegree2

        protected static boolean deleteIntermediateDegree2(java.util.List<Vertex> vertices)
        Delete intermediates with in-degree==1 & out-degree==1. (Note that it does not delete the root)

      • removeDuplicateVerticesStoreOriginals

        protected static java.util.ArrayList<Vertex> removeDuplicateVerticesStoreOriginals(java.util.List<Vertex> vertices,
                                                                                   java.util.List<Vertex> originals)
        Parameters:
        vertices - list of (sorted) vertices
        originals - out array of original vertices that were removed
        Returns:
        removed duplicates

      • removeDuplicateVertices1

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Vertex> removeDuplicateVertices1(java.util.List<Vertex> vertices)
        Removes duplicate vertices. First instance (with the earliest sampling date) remains. (hash-based distinct)
        Parameters:
        vertices - list of (sorted) vertices
        Returns:
        removed duplicates

      • removeDuplicateVertices11

        protected static void removeDuplicateVertices11(java.util.List<Vertex> vertices)
        Removes duplicate vertices. First instance remains. (hash-based distinct)
        Parameters:
        vertices - list of vertices

      • removeDuplicateVertices11NoOriginals

        protected static void removeDuplicateVertices11NoOriginals(java.util.List<Vertex> vertices)
        Removes duplicate vertices. First instance remains. Do not remove original vertices. (hash-based distinct)
        Parameters:
        vertices - list of vertices

      • removeDuplicateVertices2

        public static void removeDuplicateVertices2(java.util.List<Vertex> vertices,
                                            java.util.List<Vertex> duplicates)
        Remove duplicated entries from the input sorted list in terms of earliest time stamp. If more than one vertex with earliest (smallest) time stamp exists, leave only the first w.r.t. ID (lexicographical order). Removed vertices are added to the output list.
        Parameters:
        vertices - input sorted list from which we remove duplicates
        duplicates - output list to which we add removed duplicates

      • setStatus

        public static void setStatus(java.util.List<Vertex> intermediates,
                             java.util.List<Vertex> mixVerticesList,
                             java.util.List<Vertex> originalVerticesList)
        Set a status of each intermediate vertex. An intermediate has a status 2 iff is identical to a sequence with a status 1 or 2. It has a status 0 iff it is a new sequence.
        Parameters:
        intermediates - list of vertices whose status will be set
        mixVerticesList - list of intermediate or original vertices whose status has been already set
        originalVerticesList - list of original vertices whose status has been already set.

      • setStatusIgnoringSampling

        protected static void setStatusIgnoringSampling(java.util.List<Vertex> intermediates,
                                                java.util.List<Vertex> mixVerticesList,
                                                java.util.List<Vertex> originalVerticesList)

      • addOriginalVertices

        public static void addOriginalVertices(java.util.List<Vertex> list,
                                       java.util.List<Vertex> originalVertices)
        Add original vertices from list to the list of original vertices.
        Parameters:
        list - of original and inferred vertices
        originalVertices - list of original vertices

      • removeIntermediatesDegree2Status0

        public static java.util.List<Vertex> removeIntermediatesDegree2Status0(java.util.List<Vertex> vertices)
        Remove all inferred intermediates with degree 2 and node status 0. Removed intermediates are returned in the list.
        Parameters:
        vertices - list of vertices that represents a tree
        Returns:
        a list of the removed vertices or null (if no vertex was removed)

      • removeIntermediatesDegree1NodeStatus0

        protected static boolean removeIntermediatesDegree1NodeStatus0(java.util.List<Vertex> vertices)

      • removeIntermediatesDegree1NodeStatus0or2

        protected static void removeIntermediatesDegree1NodeStatus0or2(java.util.List<Vertex> vertices)

      • removeIntermediatesDegree1

        public static void removeIntermediatesDegree1(java.util.List<Vertex> vertices)
        Traverse a tree and Remove all intermediates (recursively) with degree 1.

      • moveOriginalsToLeaves

        public static java.util.List<Vertex> moveOriginalsToLeaves(java.util.List<Vertex> vertices,
                                                           boolean addCopiedVerticesToInputList)
        Move all internal original sequences to leaf nodes, make leaf copy for each internal original node. Traverse a tree and for each original node that is not a leaf make a copy and connect this copy to an original node. Merge these copies with an input vertex array.
        Parameters:
        vertices - input and output tree
        Returns:
        the list of original vertices that are leafs now (list of added vertices)

      • mergeNewVertices

        public static java.util.List<Vertex> mergeNewVertices(java.util.List<Vertex> oldVertices,
                                                      java.util.List<Vertex> newVertices)
        Merge old list of vertices with a new one. Clear the list of old vertices
        Parameters:
        oldVertices - old sorted list of vertices
        new - not sorted list of vertices
        Returns:
        sorted list that contains elements of both input lists

      • deforestation

        public static void deforestation(java.util.List<Vertex> vertices)
        Destroy a tree (forest). (Removes all edges and mutations)

      • deleteElements

        public static java.util.List<Vertex> deleteElements(java.util.List<Vertex> inList,
                                                    double coef,
                                                    java.util.Random rand)
        Randomly deletes coef*100% of all elements from the list
